task_summary: Detect the white and red plates, grasp the white plate from above, move over the red plate, lower until contact, place it centered, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows an xArm with a parallel gripper operating near two dishes: a white plate and a red plate. The goal is to pick up the white plate and place it onto the red plate. The behavior tree first ensures both targets are detected, computes a top grasp for the white plate, approaches precisely, and performs a pick. The robot then repositions above the red plate, descends until contact to avoid sliding, executes the placement with light press, opens the gripper, and retreats to clear the stack.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the two plates
Gripper calibrated and able to open to 0.09 m
Red and white plates are within reachable workspace
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move above white_plate
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Pick the white_plate and verify it is in gripper
Lower until contact to align to surface
Place at red_plate_center, open gripper, retreat
success_criteria: White plate is stably resting on top of red plate
No collisions with table or arm
End-effector returns to a safe clearance pose
failure_and_recovery: If grasp fails or is unstable, recompute grasp and retry pick
If contact not detected during lowering, limit depth and abort placement
If placement misaligns, re-approach and repeat place sequence
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful retreat with ObjectInGripper false and placement completed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Compute a top grasp for the white plate.
Pregrasp hover above the white plate.
Move above the red plate for placement.
Descend until gentle contact is detected.
Place the white plate on the red plate.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to glare
Collision or premature contact while approaching red plate
recovery_strategy: Abort lowering if contact exceeds threshold and re-approach
Repeat placement after re-centering above red plate
assumptions: Frames show the white plate being positioned over the red plate; minor blur/occlusion may hide exact contact moment.
Top grasp is feasible given visible approach angle.

expected_success_criteria: White plate fully supported by red plate
No object in gripper after placement
